question: Mike got twenty-eight GB of space on his disk drive to backup his files. If his files would take up twenty-six GB, how many GB would he have left?
response:
Mike has twenty-eight GB of space on his disk drive. If his files would take up twenty-six GB, he would have twenty-eight GB - twenty-six GB = <<28-26=2>>2 GB left.
The answer is 2.
